solution_line_template: The cost of the two laptops is {num_laptops} x ${laptop_price} = $<<{num_laptops}*{laptop_price}={cost_laptops}>>{cost_laptops}.
The cost of the four smartphones is {num_smartphones} x ${smartphone_price} = $<<{num_smartphones}*{smartphone_price}={cost_smartphones}>>{cost_smartphones}.
Thus, the total cost of all the items is ${cost_laptops} + ${cost_smartphones} = $<<{cost_laptops}+{cost_smartphones}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}.
Therefore, Celine gets a change of ${money_had} - ${total_cost} = $<<{money_had}-{total_cost}={change}>>{change}.
